title: Garen Needs A Rework
body:
There needs to be a point in time when we have to realize that despite nostalgia, you have to recognize that some champions just aren’t healthy as is. Garen is one such champion.
In higher ELOs, he’s absolute trash, and in lower ELOs, he teaches bad mechanics by allowing players to take advantage of people who make positioning and kiting mistakes, possibly the most common mistake made by lower ELO players, while reinforcing this "facecheck the enemy team while E is up" mentality.

He’s just a bad champion with dated abilities who desperately needs a rework. So here goes nothing.

**Innate: A Worthy Opponent**- For each second Garen is in combat with an enemy champion, he gains a stack of **Determination**, lasting for four seconds once out of combat, stacking up to 8 times. Each stack causes 5.25% of all damage Garen deals to be dealt as True Damage and grants Garen 3.75% slow resistance.

**Q: Righteous Fury**- Garen swings a mighty blow, dealing (40, 60, 80, 100, 120)(+50% AD) physical damage in a half circle in front of him and stunning enemies his for 1 second. His next basic attack deals (60, 80, 100, 120, 140)(+120% AD) physical damage.

> Cost: None 
Cooldown: (8, 7.5, 7, 6.5, 6) seconds
Ability Type: AoE, Basic Attack Modifier
Windup: 0.75 seconds
AoE Radius: 300

**W: For the King!**- **Passive**: Whenever Garen kills an enemy unit, he gains +0.3 Armor and Magic Resist.
**Active**- Garen charges forward, increasing his movement speed by (20%, 25%, 30%, 35%, 40%) for 4 seconds. Enemies within a certain distance away from Garen moving away from him are slowed by (20%, 25%, 30%, 35%, 40%) during this duration.

> Cost: None
Cooldown: (15, 14, 13, 12, 11)
Ability Type: Self Buff
Radius: 550

**E: Decisive Strike-** Garen swings his sword with blistering speed, sending a shockwave in front of him that deals (60, 90, 120, 150, 180)(+100% AD) physical damage to enemies hit and silences them for (1.5, 1.75, 2, 2.25, 2.5) seconds. This ability deals 50% bonus damage to enemies hit by his sword.

**R: Judgement**- **Passive**- Garen’s attacks and abilities that hit an enemy champion grant him heath regen per 5 seconds equal to 1.875% of his missing health per stack of **Determination**, lasting 5 seconds. Subsequent attacks and abilities reset this duration.
**Active**- Garen marks the targeted enemy champion as **Villain**. For the next 4 seconds, Garen gains +25% movement speed while moving towards the **Villain**, and deals 15% bonus damage to that champion. At the end of this duration, Garen brings judgement down upon the unit, dealing (100, 200, 300) plus 35% of the target’s missing health as physical damage.


This version of Garen is designed to give him some measure of range and retain some of his  unique characteristics, while also filling out his identity as a Juggernaut. His innate makes him much more deadly as the fight continues, a standard for the subclass. Because of the removal of the old **Judgement** and the rethinking of **Decisive Strike**, he relies more on his auto attacks for damage, and his new **E: Decisive Strike** allows him to input a small measure of utility while remaining at safe enough distance for a tank. Lastly, his ult is now designed to have some measure of counterplay. If you are low on health with no resources, it’s a death sentence still, but with a clearly defined “Do or Die” moment, it allows the player the opportunity to pop a last second **Barrier** or any other shield/heal. In return, Garen gains the ability to single out a target and be stronger against/more sticky to that champion.

These are honestly just some of the thoughts I had, and I understand that I may have him overtuned or undertuned, but the biggest thing I want is for Garen to change from what he is now to something else. Thoughts?

Gonna be honest, it's the reason why he's so bad, and the ability should be dropped from the game entirely. Its ridiculously short range, he relies on it for 90% of his damage, he can't auto during it, and it teaches terrible mechanics to players because when people are actually inside the area, it's oppressive damage, so it's very useful in ELOs that can't kite. 
That being said, you are pretty much guaranteed to have people use it, as a no cost ability, for pretty much anything. This leads not only to players that just go brazenly after the enemy in dumb situations (facechecking a bush to find a 1v5), but also players who don't farm and wave control properly, because Garen can just 100-0 minions with a little damage, so they are perma pushed.

You are 100% ignoring what I said, him having regen of some sort is fine, but it should not be tied to something that is against what a juggernaut wants to do.

Garen's passive being tied to out of combat completely contradicts design riot wants for juggernauts.

None of the other juggernauts have a mechanic that's exclusive to being out of combat.

Hell if you want to even talk about low on HP, I'm pretty sure several of the other juggernauts are even moreso dangerous at lower HP when enemies think they're done. Then they misuse skills and boom darius gets a big heal and enabled 5 stacks, or illaoi gets multiple tentacle offs, morde gets a shield back for a final fight, volibear gets his passive, nasus still has a Q+lifesteal threat. Just noone but garen is being held back by something tied to cowarding out of a fight as a juggernaut.

I like the fact that you want to make Garen into this burly bruiser with a good mix of autoattack and ability damage. Then again, his passive would be crazy considering that even if it's a small percent, true dmg can't be mitigated and you can get a lot of effective dmg out of that small percentage of the damage he deals with his abilities and autoattacks. Also, I think the after effect of the "reworked" ult would be buggy if the target were to for example, blink out of Garen's range to execute the Villain. I used to main Garen so I have a good idea on what you want to happen with him.

Also, I like the touch on the ult granting him in-combat sustain. However, I think you should either push the regen a bit higher or increase his base armor and MR to make him a bit tougher to deal with. Hopefully, Riot would have an interest in your ideas for a potential rework to Garen.

Finally, Riot wants Juggernauts to be peelable, so no slow resistances. Garen's slow cleanse is allowed because it is instantaneous.
